greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest k>=1 such that prime(n)+k and prime(n)-k are both semiprimes, or a(n)=0 if there is no such k.
comment: If a(n)=2, then prime(n)+2 and prime(n)-2 are both semiprimes; that is, prime(n) belongs to A063643. - _Michel Marcus_, Mar 26 2015
program: (PARI) a(n) = {p = prime(n); for (k=1, p-1, if ((bigomega(p-k)==2) && (bigomega(p+k) == 2), return (k));); return (0);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 25 2014
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, Apr 25 2014
